result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel Douglas Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to Probation today September 19, 2016 no later than 12:00 p.m.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation.
Court notes 2 days credit if revoked.
Defendant may apply for expungement after a period of 1 year and successful completion of Probation.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski   DF:  Samuel Douglas Johnson appeared. Case called at 8:37 a.m. Court notes this matter was set for a jury trial. There is a resolution. ADA Nieskes recites agreement. No opposed to expungement. Atty Kucinski in agreement. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NO CONTEST amended Ct 1 Misd. Battery in 14CF452. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended Ct 1 Misd. Battery per Statute 940.19(1) in 14CF452.  Sentencing arguments. 20 days to file appeal.

Crt orders:

- S/W 1 year probation. Report to probation no later than noon today. Bond will remain in effect until reports to probation. 2 day jail credit in the event of revocation. 

-   Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Jeffrey Mittlestadt. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  

- Restitution in the amount of $1,000 to be paid to Jeffrey Mittlestadt. To be paid today. 

- Court costs in the amount of $243.00. 60 DTP

- DE may apply for expungement after a period of 1 year. Must successfully complete probation

Preliminary hearing on December 16, 2014 at 09:30 am.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Jeffrey M.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.


-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
